subject: Delays in works by the contractors/ concessionaires
text: HRrf <cftv <THT wifarrut {H9 /Phone: 91-11-25074100/25074200 (i36 4ae7t 3r rof +AT) '#FH / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 wT T National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 011-5 & 6, Aqer-10, ERIGT, #f faarit _ 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn. 25th October 2011 PQLCY MATTERS__TechnicaL (90/2011) (Decision taken in File No. 2013/16/2000/Tech/GM(E-I)) Sub: Delays in works by the Contractors/Concessionaires- reg: It has been observed that a good number of disputes arise between Contractors/Concessionaires and NHAI due to cost claims filed before DRB/Arbitration/Court for delays attributable to NHAI by contractors. 2_ It has been decided that at the time of submission of proposals and while defending the disputes on cost claims in DRB/Arbitration/Court, on Extension of Time (EoT)/apportionment of delays attributable to NHAI and Contractors/Concessionaires, the pending reaches/works & its value should be bifurcated into two, one delayed by the Contractors/Concessionaires and the other attributable to NHAI s0 that the overlapping/Concurrent delays are clearly established, 3 This issues with the approval of Chairman, NHAI: (M. Chandrashekhar) General Manager (Coord:) To All Officers at Hqs All Officers at ZOs/ROs/SLOs/PIUs/CMUs/Site Offices Tt Mt NHAL AnlOQ
